Issues.Title: Pressing UpButton/DownButton should jump to the matching item when setting a part of text , which similar to one of DomainUpDown collection
Issues.Body:
Background: recently, we updated the testcase project's targeting pack to .Net 4.7.3, found this regression issue from .Net 4.7.2

Repro Steps:

1.     Create a Winforms application with targeting latest .net 4.7.3 and add a DomainUpDown to form designer
2.      Add and setting to UseLegacyScrolling quirk value to ‘true’ from default value ‘false’ in app.config file
     <runtime>
          <AppContextSwitchOverrides value="Switch.System.Windows.Forms.DomainUpDown.UseLegacyScrolling=true"/>
     </runtime>
3.     Copy following code to from1.cs file behind the InitializeComponent()
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("foo1");
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("foo2");
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("foo3");
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("Cowman");
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("foo4");
     domainUpDown1.SelectedIndex = 0; //Set SelectedIndex to a valid value
4.     Run application
5.     Input a text “Cow” in DomainUpDown, then click UpButton/DownButton

Actual:
Pressing UpButton, it jumps to foo3 item; Pressing DownButton, it jumps to foo4 item.

Expected:
Pressing UpButton/DownButton, they all jump to matching item: Cowman in DomainUpDown item. It means UpButton/DownButton jumps to the item's index.

Related internal bug: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/590429
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Pressing UpButton/DownButton should jump to the matching item when setting a part of text , which similar to one of DomainUpDown collection" (#195)

Issues.Title: System.Drawing.Primitves is part of NETCoreApp and should not require a packagereference
Issues.Body:
System.Drawing.Primitives has been part of NETCoreApp since 2.0 https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/d6173e069a9bcedfdfd7f4f41e67d23f67157b61/src/System.Drawing.Primitives/dir.props#L7

You can delete https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/457ebceaabfd2982e431c2eecbb69e80f9482e61/eng/Versions.props#L16
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/457ebceaabfd2982e431c2eecbb69e80f9482e61/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System.Windows.Forms.csproj#L20
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Drawing.Primitves is part of NETCoreApp and should not require a packagereference" (#194)

Issues.Title: Add .gitattributes and normalize source files
Issues.Body:
Normalization of text content in Git repositories is sensitive to per-user configurations, but much less sensitive when **.gitattributes** is used. This change adds a default **.gitattributes** and renormalizes all source files to match the new form.

The commit which normalizes the source files (only 2 affected files) is assigned to @dotnet-bot to avoid history confusion or unrealistic contributor statistics.

Both files which were normalized previously used CRLF line endings, so a diff of the content on a Windows machine is likely to show that the files are binary equal. The change was more about updating the Git metadata of the files.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add .gitattributes and normalize source files" (#172)

Issues.Title: Create an extensible functional UI testing solution
Issues.Body:
This issue is to track our current progress porting our existing functional testing suite as well as to encourage a discussion for a more long-term solution to functional UI testing solution.

Our current suite uses Maui as well as a wrapper library (made by the windows forms team), which are fired by xunit tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Create an extensible functional UI testing solution" (#183)

Issues.Title: Question: Implement APIs formerly provided by WindowsAPICodePack?
Issues.Body:
Some time ago, there was the [WindowsAPICodePack](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/24081665/windows-api-code-pack-where-is-it), which essentially vanished from the public. Most of the APIs provided for WinForms do not exist to the current day.

Is there any plan to re-implement some of these APIs? There are #146 and #57 which already did some of this work.

There are numerous packages from different people on NuGet trying to bring back some of these APIs: https://www.nuget.org/packages?q=WindowsAPICodePack

There is also a suggestion on UserVoice: https://visualstudio.uservoice.com/forums/121579-visual-studio-ide/suggestions/5648009-start-developing-the-windows-api-code-pack-again

If adding these APIs to WinForms is not an option, what about providing updated versions that run on .NET Core? WinForms and WPF packages could be distributed separately.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Question: Implement APIs formerly provided by WindowsAPICodePack?" (#181)

Issues.Title: update codegen naming rules to be complaint with current guidelines
Issues.Body: When I double-click a button on the form, vs automatically adds a click method, such as `button1_click`, but this naming is currently suggested and is not meet specifications.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "update codegen naming rules to be complaint with current guidelines" (#178)

Issues.Title: System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor is missing in preview 1
Issues.Body:
It is a commonly used type when WinForms PropertyGrid control is in use, as custom collection editor is needed to edit custom collection types.

It is not yet available in .NET Core 3.0 Preview 1.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor is missing in preview 1" (#177)

Issues.Title: Adding an Sdk section to global.json
Issues.Body: Adding an Sdk section to global.json. This is needed to ensure that CI servers deterministically use the version of .NET Core 3.0 Sdk specified here to build the projects in the repo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Adding an Sdk section to global.json" (#176)

Issues.Title: Use -refout to auto generate ref assemblies
Issues.Body:
Instead of having separate 'ref' projects in the solution, use -refout to generate ref assemblies automatically from src assemblies.

Details: https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/blob/233957b90f555c731f8e22b5319bb7e869567580/docs/features/refout.md
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use -refout to auto generate ref assemblies" (#175)

Issues.Title: Add documentation on running WInformsControlsTest when validating changes
Issues.Body:
This will be a temporary measure for basic validation of changes until functional test are incorporated in the process. Consider covering the following points:
1. how to build the app
2. how to run it against the newly updated System.Windows.Forms.dll and how to put breakpoint in the newly changed code
3. what actions to perform in the app besides clicking all the buttons (move across the screens, once the sample is dpi aware)
4. how to add missing controls, and edit the SP script
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add documentation on running WInformsControlsTest when validating changes" (#169)
